question: After trying for 2 years to get a U.S. visa and failing, you're devastated. What do you do next?

choices.text: Work as an ESL teacher
choices.response: You take a practical path and start working as an ESL teacher. It gives you structure, and time to reflect.

choices.text: Apply to a university in Uzbekistan
choices.response: You go back to studying locally. It's familiar, but doesn't light your fire.

choices.text: Try moving to the EU instead
choices.response: You research options, but the process is long and discouraging. You start to feel stuck.

question: In your free time, something pulls you toward tech. What sparks your interest?

choices.text: A video lesson on YouTube
choices.response: You stumble across a video and it clicks. Tech might be the way forward.

choices.text: A friend pushes you into it
choices.response: Peer pressure works. You give tech a shot out of curiosity.

choices.text: An online ad catches your eye
choices.response: You follow an ad into the world of programming. Clickbait never felt so right.

question: What language do you start learning first?

choices.response: C++ it is. Low-level, tough, but you love seeing how things work underneath.

choices.text: Python
choices.response: Python’s clean syntax feels friendly. You begin writing basic scripts.

choices.text: HTML/CSS
choices.response: You jump into visuals. It feels creative but lacks the logic you crave.

question: You hear about Najot Ta'lim Bootcamp. What do you do?

choices.text: Join for structured learning
choices.response: You dive in. The structure gives you clarity and serious momentum.

choices.text: Stick to YouTube tutorials
choices.response: You continue alone. It's slow but flexible.

choices.text: Postpone and focus on work
choices.response: You pause tech dreams. Life gets in the way — but curiosity remains.

question: You’ve learned some languages. Which one do you connect with most?

choices.text: C — I love understanding what's under the hood
choices.response: C is raw and powerful. You love knowing exactly what happens.

choices.text: Python — it feels so elegant and readable
choices.response: Python is like poetry. But you miss the raw control.

choices.text: JavaScript — I like seeing visual changes
choices.response: Instant results on screen are fun, but you crave deeper logic.

question: Time to build your first serious project. What do you make?

choices.text: CLI Tic Tac Toe with AI using if-statements
choices.response: You brute-force your way through. It’s ugly, but it works — and it teaches you a lot.

choices.text: To-Do app with GUI
choices.response: Useful and neat, but lacks challenge.

choices.text: Simple portfolio website
choices.response: Looks cool, but you feel like you’re scratching the surface.

question: Have you ever thought of giving up?

choices.text: Yes, many times… but I gave it my all
choices.response: You’re all in. When doubt hits, you remember what’s at stake.

choices.text: Yes, and I did pause for a while
choices.response: Burnout is real. But the spark never fully dies.

choices.text: No, I always knew I'd make it
choices.response: Confidence is powerful — but real struggle builds resilience.

question: Now it's time to choose your specialization. What do you focus on?

choices.text: Backend with PHP — the harder path
choices.response: You love the challenge. Backend logic feels like home.

choices.text: Frontend with JS — quick wins & animations
choices.response: Fun and interactive, but not your final destination.

choices.text: Mobile apps with Flutter
choices.response: Apps are cool, but you still want to master the web stack first.

question: Instead of using Laravel, you choose to…?

choices.text: Build my own PHP framework to understand MVC
choices.response: You go deep. It’s painful at first, but the insights are priceless.

choices.text: Use Laravel to build faster
choices.response: Laravel is clean and quick, but you miss learning core fundamentals.

choices.text: Switch to Node.js instead
choices.response: You pivot hard. Node is cool, but PHP still haunts you.

question: You’re now skilled and focused. What’s your current goal?

choices.text: Reach strong middle-level at an international company
choices.response: That’s the mission. You're well on your way — let’s see how others compare.

choices.text: Build my own SaaS or product
choices.response: You’ve got the startup dream. You’ll need focus and time to build it.

choices.text: Become a YouTube teacher or tech influencer
choices.response: You want to inspire others. Legacy > code.
